text: Belo Horizonte is a Brazilian city, capital of the state of Minas Gerais. About 2.4 million people live in the city. It has an area of 330.9 km². It is the third largest metropolitan area in the country. ==Colleges and Universities== * Federal University of Minas Gerais (UFMG); * Universidade do Estado de Minas Gerais (UEMG); * Pontifícia Universidade Católica de Minas Gerais (PUC-MG); * Universidade José do Rosário Vellano (UNIFENAS); * Centro Universitário Newton Paiva; * Universidade Salgado de Oliveira (UNIVERSO); * SKEMA Business School ==Culture and Architecture== * ARQBH ==Sister Cities== * Toronto, Ontario, Canada * Porto, Portugal (1986) * Milan, Italy * Havana, Cuba * Bethlehem, Palestine * Boston, Massachusetts, United States (2007) * Fort Lauderdale, United States (2003) * Newark, New Jersey, United States (2006) * Masaya, Nicaragua (2002) * Granada, Spain (1975) * Minsk, Belarus (1987) * Luanda, Angola (1968) * Tegucigalpa, Honduras (2004) * Zahle, Lebanon (1974) * Homs, Syria (2001) * Tripoli, Libya (2003) * Cuenca, Ecuador (2004) * Córdoba, Argentina (2007) * São Paulo, Brazil * Lisbon, Portugal (2007) * Wuxi, China (1996) ==References== Category:Capitals of Brazilian states
title: Belo Horizonte
